body:
Comment 2: 
I thought I fixed a bug like this a while back. gdb does not do well with recursive
types unless there's a typedef in the middle to break the cycle. The fix was that every
named type needs to be treated like a C typedef. I can't find the CL; maybe it didn't
get submitted.

The gob test has some great types in it, like type T *T.
_Labels changed: added **priority-later**, **go1.2maybe**, removed **priority-triage**._
